alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 17 at 2:21AM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Creeks are already running high from heavy rainfall that occurred Friday afternoon and evening. Some areas received 2 to 3 inches yesterday. Another round of thunderstorms this afternoon may produce flash flooding as soils are already saturated. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following areas, in east central Colorado, primarily Elbert and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...From Noon MDT through 6 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are already running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The soil across parts of Elbert and Lincoln county are still saturated from 2 to 3 inches of rain that fell on Friday. Do not attempt to cross flooding roadways, turn around don`t drown!
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
